author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Annmarie Hordern
description: US President Donald Trump called his meeting with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin “extremely productive” but indicated that a deal to end the war had still not been finalized, adding that he would speak to NATO allies and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.
title: Trump Says Talks With Putin ‘Productive’ But ‘No Deal’ Yet

author: Kate Sullivan, Josh Wingrove
description: Donald Trump said Chinese President Xi Jinping told him he would not “move on” Taiwan as long as the US president remained in office.
title: Trump Tells Fox News He Believes Xi Won’t Act on Taiwan

author: Leah Nylen, Josh Sisco
description: Nonprofit Media Matters for America won a court order blocking a Federal Trade Commission information demand for documents from the group as part of an antitrust probe into advertising boycotts.
title: FTC Reined in by Judge for Retaliating Against Media Nonprofit

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Hadriana Lowenkron sets the scene for President Trump’s meeting with Russian leader Vladimir Putin. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump-Putin Summit Overwhelms Anchorage

author: Derek Wallbank
description: Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin’s summit in Alaska started with a very stage-managed opening — each leader descending from their respective airplanes, a visibly warm handshake on the tarmac. Pats on the arm. A military overfly.
title: Trump-Putin Summit Began With Cozy Chat Alone in ‘The Beast’

author: Erik Hertzberg
description: Canada’s Department of Finance published a list of tax changes that the government is planning to implement, most of which were already announced during former Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s time in power.
title: Canada Shares List of Pre-Carney Tax Measures It Plans to Keep

author: Ben Bartenstein, Alberto Nardelli
description: The US is weighing the threat of sanctions against Russian oil companies Rosneft PJSC and Lukoil PJSC as part of a menu of options to push President Vladimir Putin to accept a ceasefire with Ukraine, people familiar with the matter said.
title: US Mulls Rosneft, Lukoil Sanctions if Putin Balks on Ceasefire

author: Aashna Shah
description: Washington, DC, avoided a credit-rating downgrade after Fitch Ratings removed its negative watch on the district’s debt.
title: DC Skirts Rating Downgrade as US Capital Battles Trump Cuts

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Annmarie Hordern
description: Trump has downplayed expectations for the summit, claiming that he envisions it as a “feel-out” discussion laying the groundwork for a second more important meeting that could include Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy
title: Trump Greets Putin With Warm Handshake as Ukraine Summit Opens

author: Laura Dhillon Kane
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is planning to visit Mexico on Sept. 18, according to a person familiar with the matter, as he seeks to boost trade and strengthen relations with the country amid punishing US tariffs.
title: Carney Eyes Mid-September Visit to Mexico Amid Strained US Ties

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: The pause hindered “the cessation of hostilities between Russia and Ukraine and the restoration of Ukraine’s sovereignty,” EUCOM told the the Pentagon’s inspector general
title: Trump’s Pause on Ukraine Aid Hurt Its Readiness, Watchdog Finds

author: Jan-Henrik Foerster
description: The World Economic Forum has cleared Klaus Schwab of “material wrongdoing” after a law firm conducted a review into potential misconduct of the institution’s founder.
title: World Economic Forum Clears Schwab, Names Fink as Co-Chair

author: Bob Van Voris
description: A Turkish-born businessman tied to the dismissed criminal case against New York City Mayor Eric Adams was sentenced to probation after pleading guilty to an illegal campaign contribution charge.
title: Eric Adams Donor Gets Probation as Mayor Targets Reelection

author: Miranda Davis
description: Chicago is finally getting its crime problem under control, with murders dropping to a decade low, offering a rare piece of good news to Mayor Brandon Johnson. Voters though aren’t ready to get behind the beleaguered leader.
title: Chicago’s Tumbling Murders Fail to Lift Mayor’s Approval Rating

author: Ari Natter, Mark Chediak
description: The Trump administration tightened long-standing eligibility requirements for clean energy tax credits, a move that could threaten the viability of hundreds of wind and solar energy projects under development.
title: Trump’s Latest Attack on Wind and Solar Squeezes Tax Breaks

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said he isn’t running for president in 2028 in a social media post on Friday, pushing back on criticism from right-wing commentator Laura Loomer that he’s disloyal to President Trump.
title: RFK Jr. Disavows Presidential Run, Pledges Loyalty to Trump

description: US President Donald Trump Photographer: Brendan Smialowski/AFP/Getty Images
title: Trump Set to Meet Putin in Alaska

author: Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump’s aides have created a scorecard ranking hundreds of companies based on their efforts to support his signature tax cut law, a White House official said Friday.
title: Trump Aides Create Loyalty List Ranking Corporations by Support

author: Peter Blumberg, Jamie Tarabay
description: In his two terms, President Donald Trump has repeatedly deployed the US military for domestic assignments. In 2018 and again in early 2025, Trump stationed National Guard troops and active-duty military personnel along the southern border to crack down on illegal immigration. In June, he summoned the Guard and the Marines to Los Angeles — over the objections of local leaders — to subdue protests against his administration’s mass arrests of migrants. And in August, Trump called up the Guard to co
title: Why Trump’s Use of Military in US Is So Controversial

author: Megan Howard, Katanga Johnson
description: The Federal Reserve said it will wind down a Biden-era initiative that was designed to step up scrutiny of lenders’ involvement in digital assets, building on recent moves from US regulators to embrace the crypto industry.
title: Fed to End Program That Stepped Up Bank-Crypto Scrutiny

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana
description: Thailand’s lower house of parliament passed a 3.78 trillion baht ($117 billion) annual budget, needed to support a fragile economy that’s at risk from issues ranging from the impact of higher US tariffs to a downturn in tourism.
title: Thai Lawmakers Pass $117 Billion Budget to Help Revive Economy

author: Zoe Tillman
description: Nonprofits and businesses that carry out foreign aid programs said they plan to contest a recent court ruling that empowers the Trump administration to unilaterally refuse to spend billions of dollars in funding approved by Congress.
title: Foreign Aid Groups to Challenge Loss in Trump Funding Freeze

author: Daryna Krasnolutska, Kateryna Chursina
description: US President Donald Trump spoke with his Belarusian counterpart Alexander Lukashenko, a Kremlin ally under a range of international sanctions, in a rare direct call ahead of a summit with Russian leader Vladimir Putin.
title: Trump Praises ‘Wonderful’ Call with Sanctioned Belarus Leader

author: Josh Saul
description: The Texas attorney general is investigating companies including utility Xcel Energy Inc. for wildfires that devastated the state last last year.
title: Texas Launches Probe Into Xcel and Others Over 2024 Wildfires

author: Joe Lovinger
description: Democratic state lawmakers who left Texas to block controversial new congressional maps backed by President Donald Trump are planning a return to the state early next week, shifting tactics so they can fight the plan in court.
title: Texas Democrats Who Left State Plan Return to Start Legal Fight

author: Amanda L Gordon, Nacha Cattan, Laura Nahmias
description: In Dublin last month, Jamie Dimon offered his typically blunt take on the man likely to be the next mayor of New York City: Zohran Mamdani is “more of a Marxist than a socialist.”
title: Mamdani Seeks to Charm NYC Business Leaders, Including JPMorgan’s Dimon

author: Greg Ryan
description: Boston Mayor Michelle Wu has vowed to find out from US Immigration and Customs Enforcement who they’re arresting in her city and why. But despite repeated efforts to get answers, federal immigration authorities have refused to provide even basic details, Wu told Bloomberg.
title: Boston Mayor Accuses ICE of Keeping Secret Who They’re Arresting

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump said he would set levies on semiconductors in the coming two weeks, the latest indication he’s readying a substantial expansion of his tariff regime.
title: Trump Says Semiconductor Tariffs Coming Soon, Could Reach 300%

author: Zoe Tillman, Myles Miller, Sabrina Willmer
description: Washington DC has sued the Trump administration, saying an effort to take over the city’s police force is illegal.
title: Washington DC Sues Trump, Calling Police Takeover Illegal

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski, Kateryna Chursina
description: Russia’s war in Ukraine is well into its fourth year, despite US President Donald Trump’s promise to end the conflict within 24 hours of his return to office in January.
title: The Territory at the Heart of Russia’s War in Ukraine

author: Rachel Adams-Heard, Sophie Alexander, Fola Akinnibi
description: Obscure disaster-response firms have been angling to profit from the president’s mass deportation plans since before his reelection.
title: Companies With No Detention Experience Want to Run Trump’s ICE Camps

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Today’s Alaska summit gives the Russian president his best chance of resetting relations with Washington since the 2022 full-scale invasion of Ukraine.
title: Putin Advances Goal of Luring Trump to Russia

author: Katarina Hoije
description: Mali’s military government said it foiled a coup attempt and arrested several senior army officers and a French national suspected of plotting to destabilize the junta.
title: Mali Says It Thwarts Coup, Arrests French National, Soldiers

author: Colum Murphy, Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: China and the Philippines are trading blame over an incident earlier this week in which two Chinese ships collided in the South China Sea, where both nations have competing territorial claims.
title: China, Philippines Trade Blame Over Collision in Contested Sea

author: Kate Sullivan, Natalia Drozdiak, Eric Martin
description: Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin will measure success at their summit in Alaska very differently, even as both leaders are already looking toward a second meeting.
title: Trump and Putin Have Different Ideas of Success at Alaska Summit

author: Josh Xiao
description: China has detained a senior diplomat for questioning in connection with the investigation into a key government official, Reuters reported citing three people familiar with the matter.
title: China Detains Second Key Diplomat for Questioning, Reuters Says

author: Eddie Spence, Chandra Asmara
description: Indonesia will move to “rectify” illegal mines estimated to have caused $19 billion in state losses, President Prabowo Subianto said in his first State of the Nation address.
title: Prabowo Signals Intention to Go After Illegal Mines in Indonesia

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana
description: Thai Princess Bajrakitiyabha Narendira Debyavati, who has been unconscious for nearly three years after collapsing due to a heart condition, is now being treated for a severe infection, the Bureau of the Royal Household said.
title: Thai Princess Being Treated for Severe Infection, Bureau Says

author: Swati Gupta
description: India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced tax cuts, pledged policy reform and urged the citizens to design and produce high quality goods at home, in a sweeping Independence Day speech that blasted rising “economic selfishness” in the world.
title: Modi Assails ‘Economic Selfishness’ in Defiance of Trump Tariffs

author: Anna Edgerton, Anthony Halpin
description: A look at the intriguing and complicated history between the American and Russian presidents through their six known encounters.
title: Trump and Putin in Alaska: How a Strange Relationship Took Shape

author: Sofia Sorochinskaia
description: Wine production has jumped by a quarter since Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine in February 2022.
title: Putin’s Push for ‘Patriotic’ Wines Sparks Growth in Black Sea Vineyards

author: Ben Otto, Chandra Asmara
description: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto used his first State of the Nation address to take a victory lap on the social programs he believes will drive growth in Southeast Asia’s biggest economy.
title: Prabowo Touts Progress on Key Social Programs to Drive Growth

author: Anisah Shukry, Kok Leong Chan
description: Malaysia’s growth missed official estimates in the second quarter, though the central bank said the economy is strong enough to weather an expected export slowdown due to US tariffs.
title: Malaysia Warns of Export Slowdown After Economy Grows 4.4%

author: Swati Gupta
description: India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said the nation will announce reforms in Goods and Services Tax in the coming months, a move that will significantly lower prices of everyday use items.
title: Modi Says India to Cut Goods and Services Levy in Reforms

author: Sakura Murakami
description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba commemorated the millions who died in World War Two and expressed regret, following speculation over whether he would make a strong statement on Japan’s wartime atrocities and risk anger from the right-leaning factions of his own party.
title: Japan’s PM Mentions Wartime ‘Regret,’ Toeing Right-Wing Line

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung said Japan is an “indispensable partner” for economic growth in a speech commemorating the end of Japanese colonial rule of the Korean Peninsula, signaling a departure from his previous hawkish rhetoric as he prepares to visit Tokyo this month.
title: South Korea’s Lee Calls Japan Indispensable Partner Before Visit

author: Akemi Terukina, Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s chief trade negotiator Ryosei Akazawa said US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent isn’t directly asking Japan to hike interest rates, a day after Bessent moved markets by describing the Bank of Japan as being behind the curve in fighting inflation.
title: Akazawa Says Bessent Isn’t Asking Japan to Hike Rates

author: Kiuyan Wong, Amber Tong
description: Former media mogul Jimmy Lai’s national security trial in Hong Kong was adjourned till Monday, when prosecutors will begin their closing arguments in a case that threatens to drive a wedge between Beijing and a Trump administration that wants him released.
title: HK Court Adjourns Landmark Trial of Jimmy Lai Till Monday

author: Philip Glamann
description: President Donald Trump said he’s raised the case of former Hong Kong media mogul Jimmy Lai with China, underscoring the wide-ranging nature of trade negotiations with Beijing.
title: Trump Says He Raised Ex-Media Mogul Jimmy Lai’s Case With China

author: Faris Mokhtar, Grace Sihombing
description: The Indonesian president has formed a sovereign wealth fund, reallocated billions for his signature programs and wants to influence monetary policy. Investors are concerned his ambitions aren’t matched by realistic policies.
title: Prabowo Channels Architect of China’s Economic Rise in Push for Legacy
